column1: '''Oromet''' was a hill near [[Andúnië]] and the western shores of [[Númenor]].  It was here that the [[King of Númenor]]
column3: built a high tower where he could spend many days gazing westward.<ref>{{UT|Kings}}
column4: Tar-Minastir</ref>  Well over a thousand years later [[Tar-Palantir]] often visited the tower upon Oromet in the vain hope of seeing [[Tol Eressëa]] or at least some ship coming from the west.<ref>{{S|Akallabeth}}</ref>

column1: The name is obviously [[Quenya]]<ref name=guide/><ref name=arda>{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Quettaparma Quenyallo|website=Arda}}</ref> and includes the [[Elvish]] [[root]] for "mountain".<ref>{{S|Elements}}
The meaning is obscure<ref name=arda/> but it has been suggested that the name means "last mountain".<ref name=guide>{{HM|Guide}}
column2: p. 309</ref> Cf. the Elvish root MET "end".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}
